titleStmt.title: W. W. Gardner to James F. Robinson
CWG8678

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Excelency Jas F Robinson Gov of Ky. Dear Sir

As regards the petition of the Members of the Bar of the Union Circuit Court praying the release of the forfeiture of recognisance of a bond of Saml C Hughes to the Commonwealth of Ky. I will say that I saw the blow struck and that it was a slight one on the shoulder, inflicting no injury on the person of Hon R K Williams,, I heard Judge W. say that he was axious to get the said Hughes released from said forfeiture. At the time the blow was struck Mr Hughes was much intoxicated.
